card.title: Overview
card.content:
With the _Protein PyMOL Scene Configuration_ you can ...
- change the color of the selected protein chain. - color atoms by element color. - change the background color. - show or hide hydrogen atoms. - display the selected protein chain as cartoon. - display the selected protein chain as sticks. - display the selected protein chain as ribbon. - display the selected protein chain as lines. - display the selected protein chain as spheres. - display the selected protein chain as dots. - display the selected protein chain as mesh. - display the selected protein chain as surface. - hide all representations.

guide.title: Change the color of a protein chain

steps.step: Select a protein from the tree.
Click on :google_material-open_in_new_w200:, to load the pymol session of the selected protein.
Select a chain from the tree.
Click on one of the colors in the color grid.

guide.title: Color the atoms of a protein chain by their element

steps.step: Select a protein from the tree.
Click on :google_material-open_in_new_w200:, to load the pymol session of the selected protein.
Select a chain from the tree.
Choose a representation other than _Cartoon_ or _Ribbon_.
Click on **Color** besides _Atoms by Element_. (Click on **Reset** to return to the previous color.)

note.step: Cartoon and Ribbon representation cannot be used to color _Atoms by Element_.

guide.title: Change the background color of the current session

steps.step: Select a protein from the tree.
Click on :google_material-open_in_new_w200:, to load the pymol session of the selected protein.
Select a chain from the tree.

note.step: Every PyMOL session has a black background by default. The background can be changed to white using the toggle.

guide.title: Show or hide all hydrogen atoms of a protein chain

steps.step: Select a protein from the tree.
Click on :google_material-open_in_new_w200:, to load the pymol session of the selected protein.
Select a chain from the tree.
Click on **Show** to display the hydrogen atoms. (Click on **Hide** to hide the hydrogen atoms again.)

note.step: **Show** always adds hydrogen atoms to the current active representations. This means that some representations may show hydrogen atoms while others may not.
